newsitem.title: CANADA: Trade ministers to meet in Canada for Quad.
newsitem.headline: Trade ministers to meet in Canada for Quad.

text.p: Trade ministers from Canada, the United States, Japan and the European Union will meet in Toronto next week to discuss key world trade issues.

The so-called Quad meeting will examine the agenda for negotiations under the World Trade Organization and consider regional trade initiatives, Canadian Trade Minister Art Eggleton said on Monday in a statement.
The Quad will also discuss integrating the least developed countries into the global trading system.

"We must keep the momentum going on liberalizing trade and investment," Eggleton said. "As major trading nations, we must give leadership, as well, on new and emerging trade issues. More open and competitive markets encourage trade, stimulating economic growth and job creation."
Eggleton will be joined by U.S. Trade Representative Charlene Barshefsky, Japanese Trade Minister Shinji Sato and Sir Leon Brittan, vice-president of the European Commission.
The Quad was created in 1982 as an informal forum for discussing trade issues.
